analysis.Summary: A minimalist Vue component that renders a message stating the user has no positions in their order.
analysis.Purpose: Serves as an empty-state placeholder in the orders UI when an order has zero line items.

Components.name: EmptyState
responsibilities: Accepts an `order` prop (not directly used in template)
Renders a static message when there are no order positions

analysis.Usage:
Imported into a parent orders component or section. Typically used as:

  ```html
  <EmptyState :order="currentOrder" />
  ```

Rendered conditionally when `currentOrder.positions.length === 0`.
Notes: No internal logic or styling defined; purely presentational.
The `order` prop is declared but not yet used in the template—potential extension point.
Empty `<style>` block indicates styling is handled elsewhere or not required.
Minor text typo: "You dont" should be "You don’t" or "You don’t have any positions in your order."
